title: Several spells of showers expected today
byline: The Meteorology Department states that showers or thundershowers will occur at several places in the Northern, North-Central, Uva, Eastern, Central, and Sabaragamuwa provinces, and in the Kurunegala and Hambantota districts after 1:00 p.m.

title: Trump orders nuclear submarines moved after Russian ‘provocative statements’
byline: U.S. President Donald Trump on Friday said he had ordered two nuclear submarines to be positioned in “the appropriate regions” in response to remarks from former Russian President Dmitry Medvedev about the risk of war between the nuclear-armed adversaries.

title: Speaker’s residence to be converted into Parliamentary Studies and Research Center
byline: Policy agreement was reached at the Parliamentary Staff Advisory Committee regarding the proposal to transform the Speaker’s official residence into a dedicated “Center for Parliamentary Studies and Research,” intended as an exclusive hub for Members of Parliament, Provincial Council members, and Local Government representatives.

title: Bus transporting garment workers topples in Dehiowita; all 41 hospitalized
byline: A bus transporting garment factory workers veered off the road and toppled down a precipice in Dehiowita, along the Kegalle–Avissawella main road, early this morning (02), said Ada Derana reporter.

title: One dead, one injured following clash between two groups in Mount Lavinia
byline: Two individuals were seriously injured in a clash between two groups in the Araliya Housing area under the jurisdiction of the Mount Lavinia Police Division.

title: Fairly heavy rainfall expected in parts of the island
byline: The Meteorology Department states that showers or thundershowers will occur at several places in the Northern, North-Central, Uva, Eastern, Central, and Sabaragamuwa provinces, and in the Kurunegala and Hambantota districts after 1:00 p.m.

title: Plans underway to levy hefty annual fines on illegal coastal constructions
byline: The Department of Coast Conservation and Coastal Resource Management has announced plans to introduce new legislation that would impose annual fines on unauthorized structures built in coastal areas across Sri Lanka.

title: Colombia ex-president Uribe sentenced to 12 years of house arrest, will appeal
byline: Former Colombian President Alvaro Uribe was sentenced by a judge on Friday to 12 years of house arrest for abuse of process and bribery of a public official, in a long-running case over connections to former right-wing paramilitaries.

title: Indonesia’s Mount Lewotobi Laki Laki erupts again, spewing giant ash plumes miles away
byline: Mount Lewotobi Laki Laki, one of Indonesia’s most active volcanoes, erupted for a second straight day, sending a column of volcanic materials and ash up to 18 kilometers (11 miles) into the sky early Saturday and blanketing villages with debris. No casualties were immediately reported.

title: PM reveals what govt aims to achieve through ongoing education reforms
byline: Prime Minister of Sri Lanka, Dr. Harini Amarasuriya emphasized the importance of building female leadership in today’s society, stating that the Sri Lanka Girl Guides Association possesses the ability to fulfill this need.

title: ‘Release US trade deal details & terms to public’ – Namal urges govt
byline: Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP) Parliamentarian Namal Rajapaksa has welcomed the recent reduction in U.S. reciprocal tariff rates on Sri Lankan goods, while urging the Government to disclose full details of the trade and security agreements reached with the United States.

title: Shah Rukh Khan, Rani Mukerji win first National Award after 3 decades in cinema
byline: After ruling Bollywood for more than three decades, Shah Rukh Khan has finally earned his first-ever National Film Award–thanks to his performance in the 2023 blockbuster Jawan, directed by Atlee.

title: Tesla ordered by Florida jury to pay $243 million in fatal Autopilot crash
byline: A Florida jury on Friday found Tesla liable to pay $243 million to victims of a 2019 fatal crash of an Autopilot-equipped Model S, a verdict that could encourage more legal action against Elon Musk’s electric vehicle company.

title: Digital transaction systems need to reach the villages to build public trust - CBSL Governor
byline: The Governor of the Central Bank of Sri Lanka (CBSL), Dr. Nandalal Weerasinghe, has emphasized the importance of extending digital transaction infrastructure to rural communities and actively promoting its usage among the general public.

title: Chinese national arrested for distributing ‘ICE’ to casino, nightclub patrons
byline: The Colombo South Divisional Crime Investigation Bureau has arrested a key suspect allegedly involved in a racket of selling crystal methamphetamine (commonly known as ‘ICE’) to Chinese nationals at nightclubs and casinos in Colombo.

title: Person shot and killed in Hungama
byline: A shooting incident has been reported this afternoon (02) in the Pingama area of Hungama, Ambalanthota.

title: Sri Lanka can be India’s Macau – casino tycoon Lawrence Ho
byline: Sri Lanka has the potential to become for India what Macau is to China, according to Lawrence Ho, chairman of Melco Resorts & Entertainment Ltd., as the Hong Kong-listed gaming resorts operator opened its first South Asian property in Colombo on August 2.

title: One dead, five trapped in Chile copper mine collapse
byline: A collapse at a copper mine in Chile has killed one worker and left five trapped underground, forcing the country’s state mining company to suspend operations in affected areas of the world’s largest underground copper deposit.

title: SpaceX delivers astronauts to International Space Station just 15 hours after launch
byline: SpaceX delivered a fresh crew to the International Space Station on Saturday, making the trip in a quick 15 hours.

title: Hamas says it won’t disarm unless independent Palestinian state established
byline: Hamas said on Saturday that it would not disarm unless an independent Palestinian state is established - a fresh rebuke to a key Israeli demand to end the war in Gaza.

title: Cambodia to nominate Donald Trump for Nobel Peace Prize, says deputy PM
byline: Cambodia will nominate U.S. President Donald Trump for the Nobel Peace Prize, its deputy prime minister said on Friday, following his direct intervention in halting the Southeast Asian country’s recent border conflict with Thailand.

title: Sri Lanka sees rise in garment exports led by UK, EU
byline: Exports from Sri Lanka’s garment sector increased 5.2% year over year in June 2025, hitting US $ 439.39 million from US $ 417.71 million in June 2024.

title: No restrictions on protests or student politics, but violence and ragging will not be tolerated: PM
byline: Minister of Education, Higher Education, and Vocational Education, Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya stated that there will be no obstruction whatsoever to university students engaging in protests, struggles, or student politics.
